```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

### 1. Set up a new package.

I first installed some packages that are useful for package development.

```{r 1a, eval=FALSE}
install.packages("devtools")
install.packages("usethat")
library("devtools")
library("usethat")
library(roxygen2)
```

Then, I created the project using devtools as a new project.

```{r 1b, eval=FALSE}
setwd("~/Desktop/GitHub")
devtools::create("packageyw")
```

### 2. 

I copied the `reading_in` function to a new file called `reading_in.py` and moved this file into the R subdirectory. 

### 3. 

The DESCRIPTION file automatically adds package dependencies. 

### 4. 

1. (bash, SCU) Unzip zip file from fastqc of first project sample
2. (bash) scp the fastqc_data.txt file to the package project under the `data` directory

```{bash 4a, eval=FALSE}
unzip /athena/angsd/scratch/yow4004/project/fastqc/SRR14274243_pass_fastqc.zip 
scp yow4004@aphrodite.med.cornell.edu:/athena/angsd/scratch/yow4004/project/fastqc/SRR14274243_pass_fastqc/fastqc_data.txt Desktop/GitHub/packageyw/data
```

3. Call `reading_in.R` using `source`
4. Use the fastqc_data.txt file as the `reading_in` input

```{r 4b, eval=FALSE}
source("R/reading_in.R")
reading_in("data/fastqc_data.txt")
```

### 5. 

`sed` is within a shell command that is later called by `data.table::fread()`. [sed](https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/sed-command-in-linux-unix-with-examples/) is used with the `-n` parameter to print only lines where a replacement occurred. 

### 6.

I added the following line prior to the return statement.
```{r 6a, eval=FALSE}
dat$SampleName <- sample_name
```

source("R/reading_in.R")
reading_in("data/fastqc_data.txt", sample_name = "GSM5252661")

### 7.

In the scu, I read in four files corresponding to 2 techreps each of 2 biological replicates.

- WT_2: ERR458878, ERR458879
- WT_3: ERR458884, ERR458885

Than I ran fastqc on all of the fastq.gz files

```{bash 7a, eval=FALSE}
cd /athena/angsd/scratch/yow4004/
mkdir package_data
mkdir package_data/fastqc_data_txt_files
cd package_data

for i in ERR458878 ERR458879 ERR458884 ERR458885; 
do wget -O ${i}.fastq.gz "ftp://ftp.sra.ebi.ac.uk/vol1/fastq/ERR458/${i}/${i}.fastq.gz"; 
fastqc --extract -t 1 ${i}.fastq.gz; 
cp ${i}_fastqc/fastqc_data.txt fastqc_data_txt_files/${i}_fastqc_data.txt;
done
```

Like before, scp the fastqc_data.txt files over.. 

```{bash 7b, eval=FALSE}
scp yow4004@aphrodite.med.cornell.edu:/athena/angsd/scratch/yow4004/package_data/fastqc_data_txt_files/* Desktop/GitHub/packageyw/data
```

In R, loop through the sample IDs and apply the function.

```{r 7c, eval=FALSE}
names = c('ERR458878', 'ERR458879', 'ERR458884', 'ERR458885')
out = list()

for(n in names){
  out[[n]] <- reading_in(sprintf("data/%s_fastqc_data.txt", n), sample_name = n)
}

out
```

### 8. 

I initialized an empty dataframe and looped through the index of the the output list, appending each dataframe to the final dataframe. Then, I used the `save` function to save the object to the `data` directory. 

```{r 8a, eval=FALSE}
combined_df <- data.frame()

for(i in 1:length(out)){
  combined_df <- rbind(combined_df, out[[i]])
}

save(combined_df, file="data/combined_df.rda")
```


### 9.

I kept the .rda file in the data directory [as recommended](https://thecoatlessprofessor.com/programming/r/creating-an-r-data-package/).

Please see the `data.R` file within the `R` directory for documentation.

R CMD build packageyw

### 11.

Install package via devtools and load into library. I could not get the data to load via the package so just loaded it in locally. 

```{r 11a, eval=FALSE}
devtools::install_github("yohyohwang/packageyw")
load("~/Desktop/GitHub/packageyw/data/combined_df.rda")
```

I used the `ggplot` function setting #Base as the x axis, Mean as the y axis, and coloring the points by SampleName. Since these are all wildtype samples I did not separate into multiple plots.

```{r 11b, eval=FALSE}
require(ggplot2)
ggplot(combined_df, aes(`#Base`, Mean, colour=SampleName)) + geom_point()
```
